info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 7:58AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Berkshire and east central Columbia Counties through 845 AM EDT... At 758 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sheffield, or near Great Barrington, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Barrington, Lee, Sheffield, Otis, Sandisfield, Housatonic, Ashley Falls, Hillsdale, New Marlborough, Monterey, Alford, Tyringham, East Sheffield, Hartsville, Konkapot, Gomorrah, North Otis, Newsboy Statue, Montville and Southfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
